alert.note: Alert for Champaign; Clark; Clinton; Fayette; Greene; Madison (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 12:28AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF EASTERN CHAMPAIGN, FAYETTE, NORTHEASTERN CLINTON, CLARK, EASTERN GREENE AND MADISON COUNTIES THROUGH 115 AM EDT... At 1228 AM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over Jamestown, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph, pea size hail, frequent cloud-to-ground lightning, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Springfield, Fairborn, Washington Court House, Urbana, London, Yellow Springs, Jefferson, Wright-Patterson Afb, Northridge, Plain City, West Jefferson, Cedarville, Sabina, Enon, Jamestown, Mount Sterling, South Charleston, Mechanicsburg, Jeffersonville and Bloomingburg. This includes the following Interstates... I-70 in Ohio between mile markers 42 and 85. I-71 in Ohio between mile markers 60 and 88. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
